013package org.apache.juneau.assertions;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.assertions.AssertionPredicate.*;
016import java.text.*;
017import java.util.*;
018import java.util.function.*;
019import java.util.regex.*;
020
021import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
022import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
023
024/**
025 * Predefined {@link AssertionPredicate} objects.
026 *
027 * <p>
028 * Typically used wherever predicates are allowed for testing of {@link Assertion} objects such as...
029 * <ul>
030 *    <li>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#is(Predicate)}
031 *    <li>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#is(Predicate...)}
032 *    <li>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion#is(Predicate...)}
033 *    <li>{@link FluentListAssertion#isEach(Predicate...)}
034 * </ul>
035 *
036 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
037 * <p class='bjava'>
038 *    <jc>// Asserts that a list contains te specified values.</jc>
039 *    List&lt;Object&gt; <jv>myList</jv> = AList.<jsm>of</jsm>(...);
040 *    <jsm>assertList</jsm>(<jv>myList</jv>)
041 *       .is(<jsm>eq</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>), <jsm>any</jsm>(), <jsm>match</jsm>(<js>"bar*"</js>));
042 * </p>
043 *
044 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5>
045 * <ul>
046 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauEcosystemOverview">Juneau Ecosystem Overview</a>
047 * </ul>
048 */
049public class AssertionPredicates {
050
051   /**
052    * Constructor.
053    */
054   protected AssertionPredicates() {}
055
056   private static final Function<Object,String> TYPENAME = x -> x == null ? null : x.getClass().getName();
057
058   private static final Messages MESSAGES = Messages.of(AssertionPredicates.class, "Messages");
059   private static final String
060      MSG_valueWasNull = MESSAGES.getString("valueWasNull"),
061      MSG_valueWasNotNull = MESSAGES.getString("valueWasNotNull"),
062      MSG_valueDidNotMatchExpected = MESSAGES.getString("valueDidNotMatchExpected"),
063      MSG_valueDidNotContainExpected = MESSAGES.getString("valueDidNotContainExpected"),
064      MSG_valueUnexpectedlyMatched = MESSAGES.getString("valueUnexpectedlyMatched"),
065      MSG_valueWasNotExpectedType = MESSAGES.getString("valueWasNotExpectedType"),
066      MSG_valueDidNotMatchPattern = MESSAGES.getString("valueDidNotMatchPattern");
067
068   /**
069    * Predicate that always returns <jk>true</jk>.
070    *
071    * <p>
072    * Note that this typically has the same affect as a <jk>null</jk> predicate.
073    *
074    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
075    * @return A new predicate.
076    */
077   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> any() {
078      return test(x -> true, null);
079   }
080
081   /**
082    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value is not null.
083    *
084    * <p>
085    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value was null."</js>.
086    *
087    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
088    * @return A new predicate.
089    */
090   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> notNull() {
091      return test(x -> x != null, MSG_valueWasNull);
092   }
093
094   /**
095    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value is null.
096    *
097    * <p>
098    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value was not null."</js>.
099    *
100    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
101    * @return A new predicate.
102    */
103   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> isNull() {
104      return test(x -> x == null, MSG_valueWasNotNull);
105   }
106
107   /**
108    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value equals the specified value.
109    *
110    * <p>
111    * Uses standard Java equality for testing.
112    *
113    * <p>
114    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not match expected.  Expected='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
115    *
116    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
117    * @param value The specified value.
118    * @return A new predicate.
119    */
120   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> eq(Object value) {
121      return test(x -> Objects.equals(x, value), MSG_valueDidNotMatchExpected, value, VALUE);
122   }
123
124   /**
125    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string matches the specified value.
126    *
127    * <p>
128    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not match expected.  Expected='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
129    *
130    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
131    * @param value The specified value.
132    * @return A new predicate.
133    */
134   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> eq(String value) {
135      return test(x -> Objects.equals(Utils.s(x), value), MSG_valueDidNotMatchExpected, value, VALUE);
136   }
137
138   /**
139    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value does not match the specified value.
140    *
141    * <p>
142    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value unexpectedly matched.  Value='{0}'."</js>.
143    *
144    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
145    * @param value The specified value.
146    * @return A new predicate.
147    */
148   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> ne(Object value) {
149      return test(x -> ! Objects.equals(x, value), MSG_valueUnexpectedlyMatched, VALUE);
150   }
151
152   /**
153    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string does not match the specified value.
154    *
155    * <p>
156    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value unexpectedly matched.  Value='{0}'."</js>.
157    *
158    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
159    * @param value The specified value.
160    * @return A new predicate.
161    */
162   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> ne(String value) {
163      return test(x -> ! Objects.equals(Utils.s(x), value), MSG_valueUnexpectedlyMatched, VALUE);
164   }
165
166   /**
167    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string does not match the specified value ignoring case.
168    *
169    * <p>
170    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not match expected.  Expected='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
171    *
172    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
173    * @param value The specified value.
174    * @return A new predicate.
175    */
176   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> eqic(String value) {
177      return test(x -> Utils.eqic(Utils.s(x), value), MSG_valueDidNotMatchExpected, value, VALUE);
178   }
179
180   /**
181    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string contains the specified substring.
182    *
183    * <p>
184    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not contain expected.  Expected='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
185    *
186    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
187    * @param value The specified value.
188    * @return A new predicate.
189    */
190   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> contains(String value) {
191      return test(x -> StringUtils.contains(Utils.s(x), value), MSG_valueDidNotContainExpected, value, VALUE);
192   }
193
194   /**
195    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value is the specified or child type.
196    *
197    * <p>
198    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value was not expected type.  Expected='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
199    *
200    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
201    * @param type The specified type.
202    * @return A new predicate.
203    */
204   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> type(Class<?> type) {
205      Utils.assertArgNotNull("type", type);
206      return test(x -> x != null && type.isAssignableFrom(x.getClass()), MSG_valueWasNotExpectedType, type, TYPENAME);
207   }
208
209   /**
210    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value is exactly specified type.
211    *
212    * <p>
213    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value was not expected type.  Expected='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
214    *
215    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
216    * @param type The specified type.
217    * @return A new predicate.
218    */
219   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> exactType(Class<?> type) {
220      Utils.assertArgNotNull("type", type);
221      return test(x -> x != null && x.getClass().equals(type), MSG_valueWasNotExpectedType, type, TYPENAME);
222   }
223
224   /**
225    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string matches the specified match pattern.
226    *
227    * <p>
228    * Match pattern can contain the <js>"*"</js> meta-character.
229    *
230    * <p>
231    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not match pattern.  Pattern='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
232    *
233    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
234    * @param value The specified value.
235    * @return A new predicate.
236    */
237   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> match(String value) {
238      Utils.assertArgNotNull("value", value);
239      var p = Utils.getMatchPattern3(value);
240      return test(x -> x != null && p.matcher(Utils.s(x)).matches(), MSG_valueDidNotMatchPattern, value, VALUE);
241   }
242
243   /**
244    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string matches the specified regular expression.
245    *
246    * <p>
247    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not match pattern.  Pattern='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
248    *
249    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
250    * @param expression The regular expression to match.
251    * @return A new predicate.
252    */
253   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> regex(String expression) {
254      Utils.assertArgNotNull("expression", expression);
255      var p = Pattern.compile(expression);
256      return test(x -> x != null && p.matcher(Utils.s(x)).matches(), MSG_valueDidNotMatchPattern, expression, VALUE);
257   }
258
259   /**
260    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string matches the specified regular expression.
261    *
262    * <p>
263    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not match pattern.  Pattern='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
264    *
265    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
266    * @param expression The regular expression to match.
267    * @param flags Match flags, a bit mask that may include:
268    *    <ul>
269    *       <li>{@link Pattern#CASE_INSENSITIVE CASE_INSENSITIVE}
270    *       <li>{@link Pattern#MULTILINE MULTILINE}
271    *       <li>{@link Pattern#DOTALL DOTALL}
272    *       <li>{@link Pattern#UNICODE_CASE UNICODE_CASE}
273    *       <li>{@link Pattern#CANON_EQ CANON_EQ}
274    *       <li>{@link Pattern#UNIX_LINES UNIX_LINES}
275    *       <li>{@link Pattern#LITERAL LITERAL}
276    *       <li>{@link Pattern#UNICODE_CHARACTER_CLASS UNICODE_CHARACTER_CLASS}
277    *       <li>{@link Pattern#COMMENTS COMMENTS}
278    * @return A new predicate.
279    */
280   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> regex(String expression, int flags) {
281      Utils.assertArgNotNull("expression", expression);
282      var p = Pattern.compile(expression, flags);
283      return test(x -> x != null && p.matcher(Utils.s(x)).matches(), MSG_valueDidNotMatchPattern, expression, VALUE);
284   }
285
286   /**
287    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string matches the specified regular expression.
288    *
289    * <p>
290    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not match pattern.  Pattern='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
291    *
292    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
293    * @param value The regular expression to match.
294    * @return A new predicate.
295    */
296   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> regex(Pattern value) {
297      Utils.assertArgNotNull("value", value);
298      return test(x -> x != null && value.matcher(Utils.s(x)).matches(), MSG_valueDidNotMatchPattern, value.pattern(), VALUE);
299   }
300
301   /**
302    * Predicate that wraps another predicate.
303    *
304    * <p>
305    * If the predicate extends from {@link AssertionPredicate}, the assertion error
306    * message is <js>"Value did not pass test."</js> followed by the inner assertion error.
307    * Otherwise the message is <js>"Value did not pass test.  Value='{0}'."</js>
308    *
309    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
310    * @param predicate The predicate to run.
311    * @return A new predicate.
312    */
313   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> test(Predicate<T> predicate) {
314      return new AssertionPredicate<>(predicate, null);
315   }
316
317   /**
318    * Predicate that wraps another predicate.
319    *
320    * <p>
321    * If the message specified is <jk>null</jk> and the predicate extends from {@link AssertionPredicate}, the assertion error
322    * message is <js>"Value did not pass test."</js> followed by the inner assertion error.
323    * Otherwise the message is <js>"Value did not pass test.  Value='{0}'."</js>
324    *
325    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
326    * @param predicate The predicate to run.
327    * @param msg
328    *    The error message if predicate fails.
329    *    <br>Supports {@link MessageFormat}-style arguments.
330    * @param args
331    *    Optional message arguments.
332    *    <br>Can contain {@code #VALUE} to specify the value itself as an argument.
333    *    <br>Can contain {@link Function functions} to apply to the tested value.
334    * @return A new predicate.
335    */
336   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> test(Predicate<T> predicate, String msg, Object...args) {
337      return new AssertionPredicate<>(predicate, msg, args);
338   }
339
340   /**
341    * Combines the specified predicates into a singled AND'ed predicate.
342    *
343    * <p>
344    * Assertion error message is <js>"Predicate test #x failed."</js> followed by
345    * the inner failed message if the failed predicate extends from {@link AssertionPredicate}.
346    *
347    * @param <T> The predicate type.
348    * @param predicates The predicates to combine.
349    * @return The combined predicates.
350    */
351   @SafeVarargs
352   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> and(Predicate<T>...predicates) {
353      return new AssertionPredicate.And<>(predicates);
354   }
355
356   /**
357    * Combines the specified predicates into a singled OR'ed predicate.
358    *
359    * <p>
360    * Assertion error message is <js>"No predicate tests passed."</js>.
361    *
362    * @param <T> The predicate type.
363    * @param predicates The predicates to combine.
364    * @return The combined predicates.
365    */
366   @SafeVarargs
367   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> or(Predicate<T>...predicates) {
368      return new AssertionPredicate.Or<>(predicates);
369   }
370
371   /**
372    * Negates the specified predicate.
373    *
374    * <p>
375    * Assertion error message is <js>"Predicate test unexpectedly passed."</js>.
376    *
377    * @param <T> The predicate type.
378    * @param predicate The predicate to negate.
379    * @return The combined predicates.
380    */
381   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> not(Predicate<T> predicate) {
382      return new AssertionPredicate.Not<>(predicate);
383   }
384}
